title: Marco Sturm’s faith in Marat Khusnutdinov gets rewarded with Bruins OT winner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marat Khusnutdinov scored the overtime winner in Boston Bruins' 4-3 victory over Buffalo Sabres.
Coach Marco Sturm promoted Khusnutdinov to the top line, impressed by his practice effort and versatility.
Khusnutdinov logged 15:20 ice time in the game, helping Bruins outshoot Sabres during his 5-on-5 play.

title: Why Dan Orlovsky believes Drake Maye is NFL MVP frontrunner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Dan Orlovsky endorses Patriots QB Drake Maye as NFL MVP over Colts RB Jonathan Taylor on ESPN's 'Get Up'.
Drake Maye has led the New England Patriots to a 6-2 record, with 2,026 passing yards and 15 TDs this season.
Drake Maye ranks third in NFL MVP odds at +500, behind Patrick Mahomes (+125) and Josh Allen (+350) on DraftKings.

title: Brookline farm starts free farmers market as Mass. residents brace for SNAP shutdown
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Allandale Farm and Loring Greenough House in Jamaica Plain will provide free produce on the first three Thursdays in November.
Iggy's Bread in Cambridge will contribute bread to the free farmers market responding to the SNAP benefits threat.
Massachusetts will double aid to food banks in November as part of efforts to support residents during the SNAP shutdown.

title: $9,000 in donations stolen from Catholic church in Watertown, police say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: $9,000 in donations was stolen from St. Patrick's Church in Watertown on October 27 after 5:30 p.m.
Watertown police reported the theft was discovered around 8:30 a.m. the following morning, October 28.
Authorities urge anyone with information or video footage to contact Detective Joe Kelland at 617-600-1310.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm exits game with lower-body injury
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins' Elias Lindholm suffered a lower-body injury during the second period against the Buffalo Sabres on Thursday.
Lindholm was injured after colliding with Sabres center Jordan Greenway, and he did not return for the remainder of the game.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm has no official update on Lindholm, emphasizing the potential impact of his absence on the team's lineup.

title: David Ortiz offers up advice to Mookie Betts amid World Series slump
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mookie Betts is struggling with a .130 average in the World Series as Dodgers face elimination against Blue Jays.
David Ortiz advised Betts to focus on having fun and not dwell on past game performances.
Dodgers' key players including Betts hit 1-for-15 in Game 5, averaging 3.6 runs per game in series.

title: Irish firefighter found guilty of raping woman in Boston hotel, sentenced to 7-9 years in prison
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Irish firefighter Terence Crosbie found guilty of raping woman at Boston hotel, sentenced to 7-9 years in prison.
Crosbie was visiting Boston for St. Patrick's Day when the incident occurred; this was his second trial after a mistrial.
DNA evidence, key card records, and surveillance footage contributed to the conviction; Crosbie will appeal the verdict.

title: Brockton man allegedly in US illegally sentenced to prison for raping 14-year-old girl
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Erickson Barbosa, 32, was sentenced to seven years in prison for raping a 14-year-old girl in 2020.
Barbosa, originally from Cape Verde, pleaded guilty and was sentenced in Fall River Superior Court.
He may face deportation after prison, as he was living in the U.S. illegally, per the DA's office.

title: ‘Special stuff’: Why Patriots CB Marcus Jones’s October was one to remember
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Marcus Jones signed a three-year contract extension with the New England Patriots.
Jones was named AFC Defensive Player of the Month after a standout performance in October.
Jones is third in the NFL in punt return yards, with multiple 40+ yard returns this season.

title: Dartmouth man pleads guilty to 2024 murder of New Bedford woman
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Tyler Baglini, 32, of Dartmouth, pleaded guilty to murdering Kerri Fidalgo, 31, in Fall River Superior Court.
Baglini received a life sentence with the possibility of parole in 25 years after changing his plea to guilty.
Kerri Fidalgo was found with multiple stab wounds in New Bedford; Baglini was arrested with a knife at the hospital.
